intro: Caopia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty caopia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Caopia ferruginea is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks.
